qas.question: Which two figures refused to back down after the churches worked out their disagreements?

answers.text: Nicholas I of Russia and Napoleon III

qas.question: Who wanted the Orthodox subjects to be placed under their protection?
Who arranged the compromise that Nicholas agreed to?
Who demanded the changes that Nicholas later refused?
What month did the Ottomans declare war on Russia?

context: While the churches eventually worked out their differences and came to an initial agreement, both <a0_0>Nicholas I of Russia and Napoleon III<a0_0/> refused to back down. <a1_0>Nicholas<a1_0/> issued an ultimatum that the Orthodox subjects of the Empire be placed under his protection. <a2_0>Britain<a2_0/> attempted to mediate, and arranged a compromise that Nicholas agreed to. When the <a3_0>Ottomans<a3_0/> demanded changes, Nicholas refused and prepared for war. Having obtained promises of support from France and Britain, the Ottomans officially declared war on Russia in <a4_0>October<a4_0/> 1853.
